data.title: Where to buy Windows 2003 r2 license
data.text:
Let me explain :

We have an old server that comes with an Windows 2003 r2 license tied to hardware (OEM).

We have on it a very old software that contains a BD and software to run an warehouse ( dont know the technical name but its a warehouse that store automated the packages)

The server health its quite bad (last time i removed the RAM module and put it again wont turn on ,but several attempts works)

I thinking to virtualize it on Hyper-V (do not do it yet) , i use Vmware converter and try it as a VM on vmware workstation and when i turn it on says Windows its not activated (because hardware changes)

I dont know if in Hyper-V i will have the same problem ( i think i do)

So i can buy anywhere legally an Windows 2003 r2 license? I found several on ebay and shady sites but i think are not valid in case of Microsoft comes.

Thanks

You have to buy Server 2016 license (it allows the license to be used for previous versions).

But do note if you are running on a virtualised environment, you need to license it based on the cores of the physical server…each license is for 16 cores, you need to buy more “core licenses” if the physical server CPU have more than 16 cores.

For many reasons I would recommend VMware ESXi for P2V and backup. I would boot the ESXi host using SD cards.

Thanks all of you for the replies.

Looks like i can downgrade even from 2016 watching at the link that adrian_ych send. Says " 2012 R2 or earlier"

I would prefer too Vmware ESXI over hyper-v but my maanger wont want to pay for it , so i am stuck with hyper-v (since its free , i already have Windows license paid)

I will look into a 2008 R2 license. Any recommendation where to buy it Robert? In microsoft store i only see 2016 licenses.
